oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Full Gospel Tabernacle in Jesus' Name service, 1994 November
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with music. Members play and sing as congregants keep rhythm on tambourines and with hands. As one member sings, he handles a serpent. Children wander around the pulpit. As a member of the church handles a group of snakes, he preaches to the congregation and testifies. When he is done, several women from the congregation sing and keep rhythm on tambourines.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Gifts, Spiritual; Glossolalia; Lay preaching; Singing -- Religious aspects; Slain in the Spirit; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Burton, Thomas; Elkins, Barb; Elkins, Bob; McCormick, Junior; Porter, Carl; Bill Pelfrey
Full Gospel Tabernacle in Jesus' Name (Middlesboro, Ky.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Full Gospel Tabernacle in Jesus' Name recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
